An exciting career awaits you

Position Summary
The IT Business Analyst (GIS Developer) will support multiple business groups across MPC such as Midstream, Terminals, and Refining. The role will involve development of new GIS functionality and support existing products based primarily on ESRI suite, requiring detailed knowledge of server application products. This position will work directly with business partners and other IT groups to ensure GIS applications meet business functional and performance requirements. The IT Business Analyst (GIS Developer) will manage GIS support requests from business users and will take a significant role on projects that will expand/enhance corporate GIS capabilities. Project responsibilities will include gathering/documenting requirements, functional designs, application development, and producing test scripts according to the business unit objectives.

Title: Cybersecurity Engineer I (Vulnerability/Penetration Testing)
Job_Description:
An exciting career awaits you

At MPC, we’re committed to being a great place to work – one that welcomes new ideas, encourages diverse perspectives, develops our people, and fosters a collaborative team environment.
Role Overview:
The Vulnerability/Penetration Testing is a highly critical role tasked with providing assurance for the security posture of the enterprise through discovering, assessing, reporting, and tracking the remediation of security vulnerabilities. This role performs assessments within Information and Operation Technology IT/OT environments. Identifying where systems/networks deviate from acceptable security configurations. The role is given structured opportunities to expose system vulnerabilities achieved through active evaluations (penetration tests and/or vulnerability assessments) using specialty tools and techniques that simulate adversarial techniques. This role are also known as vulnerability assessors, vulnerability analysts or penetration testers.

Title: Data Scientist (Data Analyst/Business Intelligence Developer)
Job_Description:
An exciting career awaits you

At MPC, we’re committed to being a great place to work – one that welcomes new ideas, encourages diverse perspectives, develops our people, and fosters a collaborative team environment.
Position Summary
Do you have a quantitative background? Do you like to solve business problems through data? Marathon Petroleum Company LP (MPC) has an opening in our Data Science organization for a data visualization expert. The Data Science team’s mission is to deliver business insights and value through analytics and innovation. We do that by delivering a superior suite of analytical tools and services that deliver value to the entire enterprise.
On the business intelligence side of analytics, our Data Scientists leverage knowledge and experience in business analysis, data mining, data analysis, and visualization to develop analytics solutions for critical business challenges. This position is responsible for using a combination of business acumen and analytical skills to identify, prioritize, and solve high-impact business problems providing descriptive and diagnostic insights into what happened and why it happened. The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying, cleansing, combining, visualizing, and analyzing data from a variety of sources to obtain actionable business insights. In addition, they must effectively communicate the results to managers, project stakeholders, and engineering teams.

Marathon Petroleum Company LP (MPC) Analytics & Innovation Organization is seeking a Data Engineer to join our team and build the future of our Enterprise Insights & Discovery platform based on Microsoft Azure Data Lake and Azure Synapse Analytics. This data platform serves analytics needs of the enterprise. You will be responsible for building data collection, transformation, and processing pipeline automation to deliver Business Insights critical for success of these functions.
As a Data Engineer, you should be an expert with data warehousing components (e.g. Data Modeling, ELT and Reporting) and integrations. You should have a deep understanding of the architecture for enterprise level data warehouse solutions using multiple platforms. At MPC, we’re committed to being a great place to work – one that welcomes new ideas, encourages diverse perspectives, develops our people, and fosters a collaborative team environment.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Federal Income Tax Compliance group is responsible for filing Federal corporate, partnership, and trust income tax returns; assisting with the quarterly provision work; assisting with state return preparation and review; and providing tax support to management and operations. The analyst performs multiple tasks and collaborates with internal and external organizations. This position reports to the Corporate Federal Income Tax Manager.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepare and review required federal, state and local income and franchise tax returns for assigned companies, which include preparation and review of supporting workpapers and schedules and monitoring tax calendar
